message: Hi Bob, I'm selling a product I think you'll be really interested in. I'm offering it to you for a price of...

Hi Alice, thanks for your offer. However, $200 is significantly higher than what I'm willing to pay for this product. I can buy the same product from another seller for $100. That said, I'd like to work with you if possible. Would you consider selling it for $80?
Bob, I appreciate your interest, but $80 is too low for me. Given the quality of the product, I can't go that low. How about we meet in the middle? I'm willing to sell it to you for...

Hi Alice, thanks for coming down on your price. However, I still can't justify paying $140 when I can purchase the same product from another seller for $100. To make it worth my while to buy from you instead, I'd need a better price. I can offer you $90 - that would give me some savings compared to my alternative option.

Bob, I understand you have other options, but my product has certain advantages that make it worth more. I'm willing to go down a bit further, but $90 is still too low. I'll meet you closer to your ideal price. How about...

I appreciate you coming down on your price, Alice. However, I need to be practical here. I'm still being offered this same product for $100 from another seller. While I'd prefer to do business with you, I can't justify paying more than what I can get elsewhere. My best offer is $95 - this gives you a slightly better price than I would pay elsewhere, but still makes financial sense for me.
